noun.description: The headgear used to control a horse, consisting of buckled straps to which a bit and reins are attached.

verb.description: Show one's resentment or anger, especially by throwing up the head and drawing in the chin.
examples: ranchers have bridled at excessive federal control

origin: Old English brīdel (noun), brīdlian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch breidel (noun). bridle (sense 2 of the verb) use is from the action of a horse when reined in.
